Text: Where am I?
Was that... a monster?
???: \n Raven...
Find Your Lost Memories
Zaza taught me how to ride a swing, even though I was scared.
Zaza was always teaching me how to do things.
I was an orphan.
But Mom and Dad found me and raised me like Zaza's sister.
Zaza gave me his most prized possession, a teddy bear.
When I named my teddy Zaza, he couldn't help but laugh.
I loved running without my shoes.
Zaza would always have to chase me down to make me wear them.
Zaza was a great artist, even as a kid.
Who's Raven?
My mistake. \n Your name is \n Sachya, isn't it?
Yeah... \n Who are you?

I'm Bit. 
 Listen carefully to 
 what I'm about to 
 tell you, Sachya.

Something very 
 important is broken 
 and needs to be put 
 back together again.
You mean like a puzzle?
Something like that. \n Only the pieces are you.
Me? \n But I'm not broken.
Okay, \n forget the puzzle thing.

This is a place where 
 all of the things that 
 need to be forgotten 
 are stored.

After a time, the 
 Collectors come to erase 
 those things in order to 
 keep the world running.

I need you to recover 
 some very important 
 information, before the 
 Collectors erase it.
I don't understand...
Your memories are \n scattered around \n this place.
You remember that \n monster you just saw?
It collects things \n that don't belong \n in the world.
It's going to eat \n your memories.
You need to remember \n who you were before \n it does that.

There's one memory in 
 particular, a very 
 special one - you 
 need to find it.
A special memory?
Remember who \n you are, Sachya.
Once you do, \n you can leave \n this place.

If you don't hurry, 
 those monsters 
 will eat everything, 
 including you.
If they eat me, \n what happens? \n Will I die?
Yes... \n You need to hurry.

I understand now... 
 I'll find my memories 
 and leave before they 
 can get me.
He never said no when I asked him to draw me something.
I loved things with wings.
When our pet bird died, Zaza was there to comfort me.
When I was old enough to go to school,
I was thrilled because it meant I could be with Zaza all day.
Zaza would take my hand and lead me to the school bus.
Oh, I need to hurry or I'll be late!
My first memory... Zaza's smile.
I was always trailing after Zaza.
I need to hurry up or \n I'll miss the bus!
But wait... \n Why am I getting \n such a bad feeling?
Did something happen \n to me while I was on \n the bus?
I don't like this...
Everyone thought Zaza was my brother, even me.
When the sound of the wind scared me, Zaza covered my ears.
When it was cold, Zaza would hold my hands to keep them warm.
Zaza always took me with him.
Zaza would be the one to stick up for me when I was being teased.
I wanted to be a boy just so I could stay Zaza's friend forever.
I even cut my hair to look more like Zaza.
Whenever I called Zaza, he would come find me.
Every day with Zaza made me smile.
When the adults were gone, Zaza protected me and the others.
No, get away!
The monster saw me!
What could that special memory be?
Why's this place so empty?
I need to remember who I am.

Our bus fell. 
 All the way down 
 to the bottom of 
 the world.
I was scared, \n but Zaza was \n there for me.

That's right. 
 Your bus fell to 
 the bottom of 
 the World Pillar.

You found the 
 village left 
 behind by people 
 in the past.
Being the oldest, \n Zaza did his best \n to protect you.
Zaza was a \n very brave boy.

He was so young, 
 he shouldn't have had 
 to face the terrible 
 things down there.
Right now he's \n in trouble.
Would you like to \n help him, Sachya?
Of course! \n I'd do anything \n for Zaza.
I'm glad to hear it. \n He's right over there.
The adults aren't here, \n so I've got to take \n charge.
They'll come for us, \n they have to... \n Don't they?
Until they do, it's up \n to me to keep the \n others safe.
Zaza! \n I can help.
Sachya...
I can do anything! \n I'm not scared...
I know you're not. \n You've always been \n a tough girl.
Alright, I've got \n something you can \n help me with.
Check the trash being \n dumped from up above for \n something we can use.
You think you \n can handle that?
We need whatever \n supplies we can get.
Leave it to me! \n I'll find something \n good for you.
Just be careful, please. \n I don't want anything to \n happen to you.
I'll be fine, Zaza!
What's this thing? Did \n it fall down here with \n the other stuff?
Hey, it's making \n weird noises.
Maybe it's \n someone's airboat?
If it's still working, \n it can get us back home!
I've gotta tell Zaza!
Hmm, I wonder \n if I can fly it back?
That strange, ancient machine brought \n the young me back to Hekseville.
But it was no longer the Hekseville I knew. \n And I was alone.
Hekseville had moved on without us.
Half a century passed since our accident.
Living alone wasn't easy. \n I was scared, until...
Xii...
Welcome back, Raven.
You...
Poor Sachya was so \n alone when she \n returned to Hekseville.

You discovered time 
 flowed differently at 
 the bottom of the 
 world.

A few months had 
 passed down below, but 
 half a century passed 
 in Hekseville.
Zaza's parents \n were gone.
And you were left \n all alone to fend for \n yourself.
But then you met Xii and \n became the powerful \n Gravity Shifter, Raven.
You worked so hard to \n save the children you \n left behind.
You tried everything you \n could, but nothing \n worked.

That is, until you 
 worked with the other 
 Shifter to get the 
 children into the Ark.
The Ark was only trying \n to keep them safe when \n it put them to sleep.
And here you are again, \n doing whatever it takes \n to save them.
How do you know \n so much about me?

I know more about the 
 girl named Sachya and 
 the woman named Raven 
 than you realise.
You're one of them, \n aren't you? \n Like Gade and Cyanea.
I do what I can to keep \n this world's system free \n from bugs.
You could say I'm an \n engineer of sorts.
Raven, to fix the \n present, you're going to \n have to fix the past.

Just like then, you need 
 to get the children on 
 the Ark and take them 
 back to Hekseville.
They're waiting for \n you to lead them.

That's the Zaza 
 I saw when I 
 went back down 
 the pillar.

I can't imagine 
 how hard it must 
 have been for him 
 to protect the others.
Will the Ark really \n take us home?
The children believe \n in you.
You'd better not be \n giving them false \n hope...
If this is a lie...
Even if this isn't \n real, I can't bear \n to let Zaza down.
I'll get everyone home, \n trust me.
I promised a little girl \n named Sachya I would.
Sachya!? \n Is she okay? \n Where is she!?
She's waiting for you. \n Now, help me get \n everyone on the Ark.
My new friend gave me the power to control gravity.
And all I could think of was how I could \n save the children I had left behind.
I worked with the other Shifter to bring the children home.
My promise to bring them home was \n left half unfulfilled.
I'll do whatever it takes to complete that promise. \n To save the children. And Zaza.
The man with the hat left us all alone...
He was the only adult on the bus.
The huts we found down below were left behind by someone.
They became our shelter.
In the village we made, there was a big, scary monster...
I was always afraid it would eat me.
The things that fell from the sky were our only food.
Zaza!
Find Something \n Useful for Zaza
The bridge...
Zaza!
Explore the Strange Object
What's that over there?
Zaza... There you are.
Zaza!
Protect Zaza until He \n Reaches the Ark
I have to get Zaza here...
We made it!
Zaza: \n We need to get to the Ark and get everyone home!
Zaza: \n A monster's attacking me!
Zaza: \n Alright, let's go!
That thing stole my memory...
Zaza needs my help!
We were scared and hungry at the bottom of the world.
Time was cruel. It had changed so much and left me alone.
Zaza didn't recognise the woman I grew into up in Hekseville.
His little sister Sachya was gone.
There were so many times I wanted to tell him it was me.
I couldn't bear to tell Zaza his parents were gone.
I already remember this...
Zaza, look out!
Zaza: \n Alright, let's move while those monsters are gone!
I have to get back to Zaza!
I need to stay close to Zaza.
Zaza: \n There's a monster on the next island!
Zaza: \n There's something over there!
Zaza: \n What's that thing?
Zaza: \n It's some kind of monster!
Memories
